intro: Gamochaetopsis alpina, commonly known as the alpine gamochaetopsis, is a small, aquatic plant belonging to the family Fontinaliaceae. It is typically found in cold, oligotrophic freshwater environments such as streams and lakes. The plant has a filamentous thallus that is often branched and covered with small, ribbon-like leaves. It thrives in temperate to subarctic regions and is adapted to low light and nutrient-poor conditions. Gamochaetopsis alpina plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to water filtration and providing habitat for microorganisms.
